fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Setting a date in the new issue view formatted dates will display a day behind after formatting for negative timezones.

!Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 3.51.35 PM.png|width=211,height=151!
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 11.52.02 AM.png|width=209,height=57!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 ** Set your timezone to a negative one. (the computer timezone)
 # Step 2
 ** Open a Jira instance with the new view date formatting turned on
 # Step 3
 ** Set a date on a date field (i.e. Due Date)

h3. Expected Results

The date selected should be displayed formatted.
h3. Actual Results

The date formatted is shown as a day behind the selected date.
h3. Workaround

Contact support.
fields.summary: Setting a date in the new issue view formatted fields shows a day behind after formatting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Statuses with the duplicated names but different cases in team-managed(NextGen) projects may cause the status to be filtered out for the wrong project.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Add "MY AWESOME STATUS" status in a NextGen project A

- Add  "My awesome status" as a global status, add it to Project B's workflow

- Try to use "My awesome status" status in Project B's Issue transition trigger

- You can pick the status but it shows up as a deleted status (deleted value?)

h3. Expected Results

The status should show up as a normal status.

h3. Actual Results

The status gets appended with (deleted value?)


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira renders deleted values for statuses as (deleted value?)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When getting the Project detail from API endpoint it always shows the property value as _false_ for IsPrivate
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # For a Team managed project change the access setting to "Private"
 !Access Setting Project.png|thumbnail! 
 # Use the [get Project API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-get] to get the project property
{code} https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/<pkey>


h3. Expected Results
The API should get the below property as "True"
{code}    "isPrivate": false {code}



h3. Actual Results

The _IsPrivate_ is always returned as "False"


{noformat}
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: API for fetching Project detail details does not return accurate result for the Access setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unlike old issue view, Currently when we have attachments added to the description field, we see that the original image size is not kept intact, instead, it auto adjust to thumbnail view. 

There is huge blank space between the text and the image in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the description, add a text and another image beneath, again text and image
 # Use screenshots preferably to replicate the problem.

h3. Expected Results

Image should keep its original size rather than thumbnail view and user can change as per their requirement. There shouldn't be much blank space between text and image. So having a Spacing options would be a added advantage.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-04-27-14-09-47-014.png|width=359,height=309!
h3. Workaround

You can switch to the old view and remove the "*!thumbnail*" attribute from the wiki markup to get the full size of the image
fields.summary: Keep the original image size in New issue view

fields.description:
Through manually assessing each Jira ticket manually we utilise completed the fields to determine 2 ratings of value (difficulty / pay-off - PICK) to provide an automated ranking our tasks in excel.

This requires fileds that provide:
 * due date
 * risk
 * impact
 * criticality
 * job size

We manually triage each ticket to determine which tasks we need to do in a rough order (we currently have over 800 open tickets to manage)

We would like to add a context matrix in Jira that is either a fixed or customisable solution that uses fields populated at ticket creation to assign a ranking value based on characteristics of the request. This way we will have an option to fully automate ranking our tasks as part of an automated Initial Assessment process.

This may also mean adding in additional context filters at ticket creation to capture more deliberate metrics.
fields.summary: Automated Ranking of tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you try to move issues with subtasks from a Team-managed project to a company-managed project it returns an error 500.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select issues from a team-managed project, ideally all issues.
 # Try to perform a bulk move.
 # Error 500 is returned before the "map subtask" screen.

h3. Expected Results
Not return error 500 and move the issues from one project to another.
h3. Actual Results
Error 500 screen and action not performed.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving issues with subtasks from Team-managed to company-managed returns error 500

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The bug reported by vendors.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create next-gen (team-managed) project
 # Pick one issue type
 # Try to rename it via `PUT /rest/api/3/issuetype/\{id}`

h3. Expected Results

The edit issue type REST API should respond with 400 Bad requests (if we wouldn't like to support renaming next-gen issue types or 200 if we want, I don't know) when trying to edit team-managed issue types.
h3. Actual Results

The edit issue type REST API (`PUT /rest/api/3/issuetype/\{id}`) returns a 500 status when is called on a team-managed project. The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.scope.IllegalScopedEntityArgumentException: Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (ISSUE_TYPE). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.assertGlobalIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:1119)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.updateIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:681)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.google.inject.internal.DelegatingInvocationHandler.invoke(DelegatingInvocationHandler.java:50)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy185.updateIssueType(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeService.updateIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeService.java:238)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueTypeResource.updateIssueType(IssueTypeResource.java:355)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: The update issue type REST API returns 500 when trying to edit issue type in team-managed project

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

Currently, when working on a Jira Software board, we click on a ticket, it will open on the Dialog mode and it's not possible to change that.

On the backlog it's the opposite, the tickets are opened in the sidebar.
h3. *Suggestion:*

Add the ability to select if we want to view the ticket in sidebar or dialog the same as the web version.
fields.summary: Ability to "Open issues in sidebar" when using Jira Cloud for Mac

fields.description:
*Concern* -

Currently, when we run a search for some Greek characters, we need to compare user input ( for eg this word - {{ΤΟΜΕΑΣ}}) with option name in the backend. While comparing we use a lowercase representation of both values. So we need to lowercase user input and value in the Database. We use different methods to do it due to which at times JQL gives different results. As a result, the JQL search thinks those are different options and returns incorrect results.

 

*Replication* -
 * Create a custom field that contains an option like "ΤΟΜΕΑΣ Word1 Word2"
 * Add this field and value to an issue
 * Apply basic search for this field and you will notice that looking for ΤΟΜΕΑΣ will not give any issues in return.
 * As soon as we remove the word from the value itself, the search starts working fine

In this example, the backend gives different results ({{τομεας}} vs {{τομεασ}}).

*Workaround* -

No workaround available
fields.summary: Certain characters in JQL basic search doesn't work well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to edit the a screen from the Issue layout with a Project admin results in an error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as a Jira project admin.
 # Access the project settings > issue layout.
 # Attempt to edit any screen by clicking on the screen name.
 !image-2021-04-26-19-04-45-837.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The edit screen page is displayed.
h3. Actual Results

An error occurs, and sometimes it shows the error ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS, sometimes it indicates: 
 !image-2021-04-26-19-03-37-278.png|thumbnail!

*It is important to note that the actual bug seems to be that the links to edit the screens are showing to project admins, as the screens catalog is part of the Site and Product administrators functions and is not available to project admins, so it is expected that the project admin would not be able to access this part of Jira and the solution is likely to hide these links when the user does not have site/product level administration, just like it is done in the Issue layout itself.*
h3. Workaround

Give the user the Trusted role in the User management section, to give them product-level administration. Be aware that this gives the user product level administration rights over the entire site, not just that project.
fields.summary: Trying to edit the a screen from the Issue layout with a Project admin results in an error

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

In its current state, the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget does not support team type fields such as the system default *Team* field used for Advanced Roadmaps to use in the X/Y axis.

This also applied to the following statistical Jira gadgets:
* Pie chart
* Issue Statistics

h3. Proposed solution

Add team type fields (or simply the default Team field) to the scope of the X/Y axis to be displayed in the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget.

 !Main_Dashboard_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You can use the [sumUp for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211625/sumup-for-jira] third-party add-on by Decadis AG which provides Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget that supports this field and more.

You could also copy the *Team* field into another custom field that is supported using Automation for Jira with the "{{issue.customfield_10001.title}}" smart value.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget to support Team type fields

fields.description: Especially for attachments that are not images, there should be an option to utilize single-line text links to reference attachments (instead of thumbnails). Thumbnails for non-images can cause formatting issues, and can often take up more space than needed.
fields.summary: Allow for single-line text references for Non-Image attachments
Ability to search a range of parent links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying a MS Teams thread link to a Jira issue field, a text is copied instead of the URL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a MS Teams thread
 # Click on "..." and then on _Copy link_
 # Go to any Jira issue and paste it

!image-2021-04-23-18-25-48-173.png|width=392,height=216!
h3. Expected Results

The URL should be copied.
h3. Actual Results

A text with part of thread content is copied instead of the URL itself.
h3. Workaround

*Workaround 1*
 * Copy the link through "..." in MS Teams thread
 * Paste it in somewhere - like browser or any other text document
 * Copy it again and only after this paste and copy again to Jira issue

*Workaround 2*

If you're using Mac, instead of using cmd+v, you may click left-side of mouse and use "Paste and Match Style" option instead.
fields.summary: When copying a MS Teams thread link to a Jira issue field, a text is copied instead of the URL

fields.description:

Jira should handle the deletion of the priority value better and actually display something

Deleting priority value is not registered in associated issues history

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a priority value

 # Delete the same priority value

h3. Expected Results
Change should be logged in issue history

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can open links in a new tab with the shortcut *CTRL + left click (CMD + left click on MAC)* while navigating trough your browser.

Currently, smart links will not open a new tab when try to use that shortcut on Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Add a smart link to the issue's description (in the example below, there is one to a different issue, and one to Youtube):
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-23 at 10.20.46.png|thumbnail! 
* Try opening the smart links on a new tab with *CTRL + left click*.

h3. Expected Results

Both the smart links and the non-smart link will open on a new tab.

h3. Actual Results

Only non-smart links will open on a new tab.

The smart links will still open within the same tab you are currently at.

h3. Environment

Replicated the behaviour on Windows with Chrome.

Did not replicate the behaviour on MAC (Chrome).

h3. Workaround

Right click -> open on a new tab.
fields.summary: Smart links will not open on a new tab with CTRL + left click

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The Activity Stream on the Dashboard has been randomly failing to auto-refresh. Sometimes it just goes blank, and other times it has an "Unauthorized 401" error in it. Ctrl+R brings it back to life.

h3. Environment
Dashboards
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open a dashboard
Add the activity stream gadget and configure to show some data
Set to auto refresh every 15 min.
Wait for some unknown time and it returns a 401 error.



h3. Expected Results
The activity stream should load the data, instead of returning a 401 unauthorized error.

h3. Actual Results
Should show the data on the activity stream

h3. Workaround
Have to manually auto refresh it

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Activity stream returns 401 error intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira currently doesn't allow simultaneous CSV import following this procedure:
 * [Import data from a CSV file|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-data-from-a-csv-file/]
  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the following screen in two different tabs or windows:
 ** Go to Settings-> Import and Export-> External System Import-> CSV
 # Move forward with both import configurations until the last stage(Values)
 # Hit *Begin Import* button at the same time

h3. Expected Results

Both imports to be completed independently
h3. Actual Results

Only one import will complete. The other one will inherit the completion information from the last imported CSV.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround to import multiple CSVs simultaneously.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Automation for Jira, you have the ability to copy rules on both the *Global Administration page* or inside of a *Project Automation page*. If you try to copy a rule from another Project on the Project Automation page, you will receive the following error: "*Failed to retrieve selections, please refresh the page and try again.*"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Got to your *Project Settings > Automation* page (*Project Settings > Automation > Automation* if you are in a Service Project)
 # On the *Rules* tab, click in *More options > Copy rules*
 # Select a different project and try to select a rule from it.

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown shows the rules if you have access to the selected project.
h3. Actual Results

You will receive the "*Failed to retrieve selections, please refresh the page and try again.*" error independently if you have access to the selected project or not.
h3. Workaround

Execute the steps 2-3 directly from the *Global Administration* page:
{noformat}
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.codebarrel.addons.automation/cb-jira-automation-rules{noformat}
fields.summary: Copying rules inside a Project from another Project in Automation for Jira fails to retrieve rules

!image-2021-04-22-09-52-32-590.png!
fields.summary: Gmail Atlassian Plugin Should Have "OPEN IN JIRA" at the Top, Rather Than the Bottom

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Standard custom fields are available to be edited for *Team managed* projects when using bulk edit. However, they are never available in the issue view because they cannot be added to the context of the *Team managed* project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to. *Issue Search* and select a *Team managed* as well as a *Company managed* project so that issues from both the projects show up.
 # Bulk change all the issues to modify a custom field.
 # The bulk change is successful and we are able to see the value updated in *Issue Search* -> *List View* for issues from both *Team managed* as well as *Company managed* projects.
 # Add this custom field to the *View Issue* screen of the *Company managed* project and we should be able to see the updated values appear in the issues.
 # This custom field however is not available to be added to the screen of the *Team managed* project and hence we cannot see the field and the value updated in the issue view for *Team managed* project issues.

h3. Expected Results

As the standard custom fields cannot be made available for use within a *Team managed* project, they shouldn't be available for an update via bulk edit.
h3. Actual Results

Standard custom fields are available for edit bia a bulk action but not for adding them to the screens of *Team managed* projects.
h3. Workaround

If you have already made a bulk update of issues from *Team managed* projects and are expecting the field to be available in the issue view,
 # Export the values of the field corresponding to those issues from Issue search.
 # Create a similar custom field within the *Team managed* project.
 # Using External System Import -> Import from csv, import the previously exported values and map them against the newly created custom field.
fields.summary: Standard custom fields are available to be edited for Team managed projects when using bulk edit

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 20 May 2021}
Hi everyone,

We have rolled out the fix to all customers.
  
Thanks for your patience and understanding.

Kamil Grinholc
JIRA JQL Search team
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 14 May 2021}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for voting and watching this issue over the last few weeks. We have read your comments and recognise the problem this has caused.
Today we have started rolling out the fix and we are planning to progressively roll it to the whole production with urgency. 
  
Thanks for your patience and understanding.

Kamil Grinholc
JIRA JQL Search team
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Searching for some project scoped fields with IS EMPTY operator gives inaccurate results. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have at least two custom fields with the same name (e.g. _Component_) and scope to different projects or between global and project scope (e.g. custom field 10000 scoped to project A and custom field 10001 scoped to project B)
 # Try to find issues from project A that don't have _Component_ field set

{code:java}
project = A AND Component IS EMPTY
{code}
OR
 The issue is also experienced when only one custom field is present but a context is applied to limit the custom field to certain projects.
h3. Expected Results

Search checks value only of _Component_ field scoped to given issue (project).

In our example search should return issues from project A that don't have value in _Component_ field that is scoped to project A (custom field 10000). Issues from project A that don't have value in _Component_ field 10001 should be ignored as that custom field is scoped to project B.
h3. Actual Results

Search checks checks all _Component_ fields (ignores that some of them are not in project scope).

In our example search currently returns all issues from project A as they don't have value in _Component_ field that is scoped to project B (10001).
h3. Workaround

Refer in your JQL search to the custom field by id, ie:
{code:java}
project = A AND cf[10000] IS EMPTY
{code}
instead of
{code:java}
project = A AND Component IS EMPTY
{code}
To find id of custom field scoped to given project use [GET /rest/api/3/field resource|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-fields/#api-rest-api-3-field-get].
fields.summary: Inaccurate JQL search results when using IS EMPTY operator with duplicate fields

fields.description:
Like JSU on Jira Server, Jira Cloud proposes a "Field required" validator in transitions.

 

However, when fields are set as required in the workflow, they do not appear differently from optional fields in the screen.

It is a big step backwards, and it can lead to confusing results.
 # JSU on server proposes the best option: a red asterisk appears next to the field name.
 # Jira Cloud could propose the same functionality

 

Some community members suggest setting up directly a red asterisk or a "required" information in the screen name, but this workaround is way too rigid is some business cases.
fields.summary: Make validator required fields more visible on screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting an issue link type from the Linked Issue dropdown, long items are cut off by the dropdown and there is no affordance to display the full item name when hovering over it.

!link-type-cutoff.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open the dropdown to select the issue link type from the Linked Issues dropdown
# Hover over an item which is too long to fit in the width of the dropdown

h3. Expected Results

There is a way to see the full name for the item

h3. Actual Results

The full name is not visible

h3. Workaround

* Force the dropdown width to be wider by resizing the window. 
* View the issue in single column view so the issue link type dropdown takes the full page width
fields.summary: Linked issue dropdown items are cut off when the dropdown is too narrow

fields.description:

fields.description:
Currently, there is no option to show all existing teams on _<sitename>.[atlassian.net/people|http://atlassian.net/people]_. You have to be a part of a team to display it under the "your teams" section, or you can use the search bar to search for a team.

However, there is no option to display all existing teams - even if you are a Jira administrator or site admin.

This would be beneficial when browsing/searching for a specific team within an organization.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a custom field that no longer exist in the JQL of a webhook breaks some events on all webhooks in the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook, including a JQL in it to reduce the scope of it, include a custom field in the JQL. Also, include events like _Issue updated_ in it.
# Delete the custom field that is indicated in the JQL of the webhook, from the custom fields catalog.
# Perform an action that would trigger the webhook, like updating an issue fields.

h3. Expected Results
The webhooks that match the event triggered will send their correspondent web requests for the _Issue updated_ event.

h3. Actual Results
All the _Issue updated_ events stop working in all the webhooks in the site regardless if they include the inexistent custom field in their JQL and even if you create a new webhook after the custom field has been deleted.

h3. Workaround
Ensure no JQL includes inexistent custom fields in webhooks.
fields.summary: Having a custom field that no longer exist in the JQL of a webhook breaks some events on all webhooks in the site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Focused comment (Permalinks) in the Jira new issue view does not jump to the focused comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a focused comment on the Jira issue. 
 # Click on the 'focused comment' link.

h3. Expected Results
It should jump or scroll the page to the focused comment.

h3. Actual Results
It does not jump to the focused comment, however, it updates the URL with the 'focusedCommentId'.

h3. Workaround
Click on the 'focused comment' link and open it using a new tab.
fields.summary: Focused comment (Permalinks) in the Jira new issue view does not jump to the focused comment.

fields.description:
As of now we can only update standard set of fields from MS teams in Jira.
Current fields that can be updated : Summary, Description, Assignee, Status, Priority, add Comment. 

It would be great if we can allow users to update more fields directly from MS teams into Jira.
fields.summary: Allow more fields to be updated via the screen in MS Teams into Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Branch created" trigger is suddenly triggering on each commit that is created within the branch.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose branch created trigger
 # Provide subsequent action for the trigger. 
 # You will observe when a commit is created, the branch trigger will be executed. 

h3. Expected Results

Only when a branch is created, the rule should trigger
h3. Actual Results

Whenever a commit is pushed for a branch we will see that the rule is triggered.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Latest update : The fix has already been rolled out and the issue no more exist.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira : "Branch created" trigger is suddenly triggering on each commit that is created within the branch.

fields.description: Provide the ability to modify/rename the existing system fields in Jira.
fields.summary: Rename system fields in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the excel file have a text box, the excel viewer unable to display the file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an excel file and add a text box
 # Create JIRA issue and attached to the issue.
# Click the excel file

h3. Expected Results
Excel file display in the excel viewer
h3. Actual Results
Excel viewer show blank page.

h3. Workaround
Open the file via Microsoft Excel
fields.summary: Unable to view excel file via excel viewer when it contain text box

fields.description:
When we save a filter that includes a custom field, Jira should save the field based on its id rather than the name of the filter.

For now, if we rename a field, it will break all the Filters, Automation Rule when the Field is in use.

h3. How this is going to benefit us:
1. Saving a filter using the filed name, if we rename the field, we get the error - "Field 'alpha' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it."

2. If we use, field ID -> example *cf[10131] is not empty* , this continues to work even if we rename the field.
fields.summary: Jira should store the custom field details based on field ID instead of the field name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation fails to render some Jira avatars when 3rd party cookies are disabled in web browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a project with a custom avatar
# Disable 3rd party cookies in the browser configuration or access Jira using incognito mode if 3rd party cookies are disabled for this mode 
# Open the automation rule list where the project name is displayed

h3. Expected Results
Avatars and project names should load properly

h3. Actual Results
* The avatar does not load and the project name is duplicated and overlapped as shown in the attached image.
* A 403 error is received.

h3. Workaround
The avatar and name will load properly only if 3rd party cookies are allowed.
fields.summary: Automation fails to render some Jira avatars when 3rd party cookies are disabled in browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can configure gadgets to refresh automatically after an amount of time.

Currently, if you leave a tab open for a long time (e.g. around 1 hour), the gadget will return a 401 error when you go back to that tab when it tries to refresh itself:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 17.03.17.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 17.02.35.png|thumbnail! 

Manually clicking on the ellipses button -> Refresh will not work. 

That was more easily replicable with the roadmap gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a roadmap gadget
* Set its refresh internal to 15 minutes
* Leave the tab where the gadget is, and come back after around 1 hour

h3. Expected Results

The gadget will reload normally.

h3. Actual Results

The gadget fails with a 401 error.

h3. Workaround

Reload the page.
fields.summary: Gadgets returns 401 after a long time of inactivity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The default "Comments from emails" mail handler prevents an issue from being created if a  _Forward Email_ is set and the said mail handler comes first in the list of *Mail Handlers* at the {{IncomingMailServers}} section in Jira:
- https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a setup like this:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-18 at 12.26.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the first mail handler to switch its position to make sure the default *Comments from emails* process the message first:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-18 at 12.31.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Set a fwd email address to the *Comments from emails* mail handler.

h3. Expected Results
The message will be first processed by the *Comments from emails* mail handler, which will throw the following error in logs:
{code}Comments from emails - Cannot handle message as destination project has not been configured.{code}
If there isn't any forward email address set, the next mail handler will attempt to process the message, which will most likely succeed, and the following logs will show up:
{code}Create Issue - SOUP - Issue SOUP-14 created 	 	 
Create Issue - SOUP - No Issue found for email 'A new test email ' - creating a new Issue. 	 	 
Create Issue - SOUP - Issue Key not found in subject 'A new test email'. Inspecting the in-reply-to message ID. {code}

h3. Actual Results
If a fwd email is in play, the message will not be processed by the second mail handler in the list.
fields.summary: Default mail handler prevents issue from being created if Forward Email is set

fields.description:
h3. Problem

JQL search against an instance with many entity properties and when searching for the entity property results in slow performance and sometimes times out after the 30s time limit.

The problem manifests itself when using the following APIs, either directly or via an app:
- [GET /rest/api/2/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/api-group-issue-search/#api-rest-api-2-search-get]
- [GET /rest/api/3/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-search/#api-rest-api-3-search-get]
- [POST /rest/api/2/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/api-group-issue-search/#api-rest-api-2-search-post]
- [POST /rest/api/3/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-search/#api-rest-api-3-search-post]

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the scalability of issue search to cater to such entity property queries.
h3. Why This Is Important

Some add-ons rely on entity properties, and as more customers use these add-ons and their data grows, they may run into issues when running queries against the entity properties.

h3. Notes
When using the Atlassian API, either directly or via an app, the internal timeout currently returns a {{500}} status code, with is incorrect and does not represent the nature of the problem. This is tracked separately as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-77242.

h3. Workaround

Reduce the search scope to a more specific result set (e.g., with a project in () clause, search against a subset of projects).
fields.summary: JQL search against a large number of entity properties results in timeout errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Jira New Issue View, if a checkboxes custom field is added to the screen, the options dropdown may get overlapped by the comment field, causing some options not able to be selected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new 'Checkboxes' custom field and add it to the issue view screen.

h3. Expected Results

The options in the custom field should show up correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown from the custom field is overlapped by the comment area:
 
!Screen Shot 2021-04-20 at 15.37.26.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Switch to a different tab on a the activity area on the issue view. Issue seems to occur only when the activity section is showing the comments tab.
fields.summary: Checkboxes custom field options overlapped by Comments field on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using Jira Issues Calendar gadget along with Created Vs Resolved chart does not display information box upon hovering on the data points of the Created Vs Resolved Chart.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and save a Filter with all the issues in Jira
 # Create a Dashboard and add the Gadget *Created Vs Resolved Chart*, use the saved filter in step 1.
 # Add the gadget *Issues calendar*, use the same filter on this gadget too.

h3. Expected Results

When we hover on the data points within the Created Vs Resolved Gadget, an information box should be displayed on the screen with the number of issues Created and Resolved within a date range. 

!Screenshot 2021-04-14 at 10.33.41 PM.png|width=405,height=379!
h3. Actual Results

No information is displayed on Created Vs Resolved chart when we hover on the points. However, the chart works as expected when the Issue Calendar gadget is deleted from the dashboard or if it is in the edit mode.

!Screenshot 2021-04-14 at 10.33.21 PM.png|width=883,height=388!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing an issue, if you click on *Filter* at the top bar and selecting a filter from the drop-down menu, Jira will not display the selected filter but it'll display the last search made by the user. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# At the *Issue Search*, create any JQL and press Enter to display the result
# Access any issue on your Jira
# Click on *Filter*, at the top bar, and select any filter there

h3. Expected Results
Jira should display the selected filter result.

h3. Actual Results
Jira is displaying the last search made instead of the selected filter.

h3. Workaround
After getting redirected to the wrong filter, click again in the desired filter from the left menu.

fields.description: When a Connect App with admin permissions (from user permissions and app scopes) edits issue with {{PUT /rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}}}, it can override the screen security configuration using {{overrideScreenSecurity}} and {{overrideEditableFlag}}. The reasons for these overrides also apply to create issue. Please make these 2 overrides available on {{POST /rest/api/3/issue}}.

fields.description:
As an admin when importing issues there might be times when needing to update the issue history information is required in order to address things that weren't moved/copied accordingly, which consequently might affect reports using the issue history data. 

Thus, as an admin we'd like to have the ability of modifying the issue history tab (e.g.: add entries, change order, remove entries, etc)
fields.summary: Ability to edit the information of issue history Tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the only way to see the name of the current issue type applied to an issue in the new view is by hovering over its name:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 10.22.50.png|thumbnail! 

But, if you do not have permission to edit the issue, be it trough the permission scheme or by using an workflow property such as *jira.permission.edit.group*, or even if you do not have the *Move* permission when there are different workflows, a warning will be displayed instead of showing the name of the issue type.

See the recording:  [^Issue type warning.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Make sure you do not have the permission to edit an issue;
* Hover over the issue type icon on the new view.

h3. Expected Results

Although you cannot edit the issue type, you should be able to view its name when hovering over its icon.

h3. Actual Results

A warning icon is displayed instead.

h3. Workaround

Currently, you can still check the name of the issue type by hovering over it on the issue search navigation, or in the results of gadgets:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 10.33.33 (2).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue type name is not displayed when you do not have permission to edit issue in the new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a custom field using the _Parent Link_ field type, the field name will be ignored and only display the name "Parent Link" in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new custom field using the _Parent Link_ field type and give it any name (eg. Father link)
# And the new field to your issue screen and view it from the issue details
 !Custom_fields_-_link.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

You should see the custom field in the issue details with the name that was given "Father link".

h3. Actual Results

Regardless of the name you give it, the field will be displayed as "Parent Link".
 !_TST7-105__TEST__CLONE__-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

This bug is only seen in the issue details of the new view, in the old view and other areas like columns for issue searches, the correct name is displayed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Parent Link custom field doesn't display the correct field name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If users have a the character colon ":" in their account ID , for example 557057:70187d3c-b6f.... then "worked on" data under their profile is not loaded.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on profile icon on top right in Jira -> Click "Profile"
 # Verify "Worked on" section

h3. Expected Results

Data should get loaded
h3. Actual Results

No results are loaded as the character ":" is replaced with %3A in the browser URL. Hence the request fails.
h3. Workaround

Replace the %3A with ":" in the Browser URL at the end , the data should get loaded.
fields.summary: "Worked on" data is not loaded if user account ID has ":" in it

fields.description:

The new issue view editor does provide markdown formatting options you can use on the fly like ":"  to list the emoji options. See:
* https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-symbols-emojis-and-special-characters/ 
* https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/markdown-and-keyboard-shortcuts/

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Search template of a custom field is set to None, sorting such field by date in the Filter Results Gadget results in error. The Gadget cannot be reconfigured to use a different filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom field of type Date picker and set the Search template as None.
 # Associate the Custom field with required screens.
 # Filter issues, add custom field to the results column, save the filter.
 # Configure Filter Results gadget using saved filter.
 # Sort Custom field column in Filter Results gadget

h3. Expected Results

It is expected to see an error as the Search Template for the custom field is set as None. If the field is not searchable, the JQL cannot be executed and hence the error in Dashboard gadget. But the user should be able to reconfigure the Gadget to use a different filter.
h3. Actual Results

Below error will be displayed and user will not able to reconfigure the Gadget.
 The filter configured for this gadget could not be retrieved. Please verify it is still valid on the issue navigator.
h3. Workaround

Update the Search template of the custom field to *Date Time Range Picker* to make sure the field is searchable.
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget fails to load if the Search Template of a custom field is set to None

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you change the date format jira.date.picker.java.format in advanced settings to use a year format of 4 digits like this d/MMM/yyyy and you set the year manually with 2 digits in the date picker fields like due date, Jira will auto-complete the year with 2 zeros causing the field to stop working and when you try to edit the field it disappears.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the date format jira.date.picker.java.format in advanced settings to use a year format of 4 digits like this d/MMM/yyyy
 # Create an issue setting the due date manually with a year of 2 digits
 # See the video below, it includes the bulk edit workaround
https://share.getcloudapp.com/llu5N0jj

h3. Expected Results
The year is auto-completed correctly

h3. Actual Results
Jira adds 2 zeros at the beginning of the year


h3. Workaround
If the issue was created and needs to be edited, you can use a bulk edit operation to put the correct date.
fields.summary: Changing the date format "jira.date.picker.java.format" in advanced settings causes wrong dates like 0021

fields.description: I would like to request the option when cloning an Epic to also clone all the tasks currently associated with that epic (same functionality as a task and sub tasks).
fields.summary: Cloning an Epic - Include all Tasks/Child issues

fields.description:
h3. How the feature works

When Sorted "newest first" , the comment will display in the following manner. When user try to add a new comment, the comment box will move up right on top of the "latest comment" so you can see the latest comment as you type in new ones. 
[Comment 1] (newest/latest comment)
[Comment 2]
..
[Comment 5]
(click to see 100 older comments)

 

When sorted "Oldest First", the comment will display in the following manner
[comment 1] (oldest comment)

...

[comment 4]

[comment 5](5th oldest comment)

(click here to see 100 newer comments)

h3. How it should work

Regardless of the comment order, the newer comments should not be collapsed, as it is time-consuming to expand multiple comments until we reach the newest one.
fields.summary: Newer comments should not be collapsed, regardless of the sort order

fields.description: Currently, the option to Include Subtask remains enabled and there is no option to keep it on/off by default for a specific project or for the entire Jira. Any such settings will help the customers to visualise the data as per their requirement.

fields.description:

Last Seen date is updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, when a user is mentioned in a comment (not added to any other fields such as assignee, watcher or reporter) then an email notification is sent to the mentioned user.

If a user is mentioned in a comment and comment visibility is restricted such that the comment is visible to a group in which the mentioned user is not a member of, then email notification is not sent to the mentioned user as expected. However, if the comment visibility is edited later to "Viewable to all users", then the mentioned user does not receive email notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a Jira project and create an issue
2. Type a comment "@" mentioning User1
3. Before adding the comment, set the comment visibility to a private group - Group1. Make sure that User1 does not belong Group1
4. Add the comment 

+Outcome at this point+: Email notification is not triggered to User1 as the comment is restricted.

5. Now change the comment visibility of the same comment to "Viewable to all users". The mentioned user does not receive email notification as notification is not triggered.
6. If a user is "@" mentioned in a comment with no restriction, then a notification is triggered
7. If "@" mentioned user is reporter, assignee or watcher, then "Comment edited" trigger is used. But for "@" mentioned user who does not belong to any field in the issue, email is not sent on editing comment visibility

h3. Expected Results
The mentioned user receives an email notification once the comment visibility is set to "Viewable to all users" or a group/project role in which the user is a member.

h3. Actual Results
Email notification is not sent to the mentioned user when the comment visibility is changed to "Viewable to all users".

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the visibility of a comment which has a user mention does not trigger an email notification to the mentioned user

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to restrict the KBA articles for different groups within a project.

Case scenario:
we have a project "A" and we linked 2 different  kba spaces
Added to 2 groups of users, these is no option for article restrictions, if we want to restrict few articles only for 1 customer group

fields.description:
In the [current API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-field-configurations/#api-group-issue-field-configurations] there is no way to add a field to a field configuration

fields.description:
In the [current API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-statuses/#api-group-workflow-statuses] there is no way to create a workflow status. This means that it is not possible to create a workflow using custom statuses through the REST API - only create workflows using preexisting statuses. This is a shortcoming. 
h3. Suggestion

Add a supported REST API for Jira Cloud to create a new workflow status.
fields.summary: Add a REST API endpoint to add new workflow status

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
# Create a software project
# Delete the board associated to the project.
# Navigate to /issues page . https://your_site.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/<project_key>/issues/
# Click on "Back to project" when the issues are loading. 

h3. Expected
Identify that there is no board to navigate to and display the project settings panel instead.

h3. Actual.
Reloads the /issues page . Refer screen recording.

Note: Back to project works as expected after the page has completely loaded.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the old issue view, hovering on the workflow transition button will show a tooltip of the description of the workflow transition. This is missing on the new issue view.

!Screen Shot 2021-04-16 at 11.16.53 (2).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a tooltip that shows the workflow transition description when hovering over a transition name on the new issue view.
fields.summary: Tooltips for workflow transitions on New Issue View

fields.description:
{quote}As a Jira community member looking for answers

I want a filter for Solved questions

So I can target my searches to things that can help me
{quote}
And ...
{quote}As a Jira community member looking for questions to answer

I want a filter for Not Solved questions

So I can target my searches to things I can help with answering
{quote}
 

Business Case:

_Sorry, I put this one under Jira Cloud... I could not find a suggestion area for the community forum.  ;^)_

The community forums have question searching and filters for un-answered questions. However often the answered ones are still not solved, so members need to pour through those to find specific answers.  The same is true for community members seeking to help by answering questions.  Having filters for Solved and Not Solved will help both be more effective.
fields.summary: add filter to community posts for Solved and Not Solved questions

fields.description:
When accessing an issue in Jira with Time Tracking enabled, if the time tracking field is empty, Jira will display it as a 0m instead of empty. 

This causes issue since zero minutes and an empty value would display the same information: *0m*

h3. Solution suggested
Allow Jira to display values for Original and Remaining Estimate as empty instead of 0m when they have no value for it.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to see empty values from Estimation as empty but not as 0m from the New Issue View

fields.description:
Currently, the project scope options available in the automation use references with a project that is deleted and which requires manual intervention in removing the deleted project from the rule.

Hence, it would be nice to have a new project scope option in the automation rule which is based on "project category".
fields.summary: Add a new scope based on "Project Category"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom field search using customfield ID also should be possible so that if at all rename of the field happens, we would still do not have to change the filter everytime and the filter would still work as expected. 

It would be great to have this feature
fields.summary: Custom field search using ID and name in JQL

fields.description: In order to use Confluence and Jira together properly, it would be great to have the option to show all Confluence tasks on a Jira Dashboard. Therefore, a gadget to show Confluence tasks was great.
fields.summary: Display Confluence tasks on jira dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement:

The way the issue history is presented via individual records, instead of changelog records is confusing.

*Use Case:*

Our instance heavily uses automation and I need to know in which changelog record an action has happened, i.e. I need it to be in the old style, grouped. Please see the attached screenshots.
 * !Screenshot 2021-04-15 at 11.12.36 AM.png|thumbnail! (New Issue view)
 * !Screenshot 2021-04-15 at 11.12.52 AM.png|thumbnail! (Old Issue view)

h3. Suggestion: 

Show the issue history as grouped instead of individual records.
fields.summary: Show issue history as grouped instead of individual records in New issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pasting an image when Creating an issue (using the "Create" button) also pastes the issue into an open issue being edited prior to the new ticket.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the description of a ticket (stay in edit mode)
 #  Click "Create" to start a new ticket. Modal appears.
 # In the desc. of the new ticket, paste a screenshot.

h3. Expected Results

The paste should only be attached to the new/most recent modal (the "create" ticket), not both.
h3. Actual Results

It gets pasted into both tickets' descriptions - the create dialog AND the description field of the issue behind the dialog.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Pasting an image into the Create dialog also inserts into an editing field in an open issue

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have the option to select what type of notification the workflow validator provides.

Each option (old and new issue view) has pros and cons.

The old issue view provides a more invasive, noticeable, and easy-to-view notification. Also is possible to copy the error message easily.

!image-2021-04-14-17-44-43-691.png|width=575,height=231!
 The new issue view gives a more discrete pop-up, but is gone within a few seconds and is harder to copy/analyze. 

!image-2021-04-14-17-44-19-421.png|width=573,height=185!

Having both options available to set on workflow/project/personal preferences would please all.

Other options:
 * Disable auto dismiss pop-up.
 * Option to "stick" the pop-up or to open the message on a permanent window.
fields.summary: Ability to choose type of pop-up notification for Jira Workflow validator. (New Issue View)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new issue view has a different means to create issue links.  This new interface still permits you to enter in an exact issue key in addition to searching for issues. However when you enter an issue key into this form and press enter, a lozenge that shows the issuetype icon and the beginning of the project key.  The problem here is that this does not show you the complete issue key and in turn can cause confusion about the specific details of the issue link you are creating.  This truncated issuekey is in appearance only.  If you complete the link it works as expected,

But this is a problem because when you view this link before it is completed, it can easily appear as if you were about to link a different issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In new issue view, click the 'Link issue' button and begin creating an issue link
 # In the Linked issues dialog that this takes you to, enter in an issuekey, such as an example one of CMX-2797
 # Press enter
 # Choose the link type (relates to, duplicates, clones, etc)
 # Review your link before you click the blue 'Link' button to create that link

!looks correct key before pressing enter.png|width=389,height=72!
h3. Expected Results

I expect that Jira will show you the exact issue key of the issue you are trying to link to
h3. Actual Results

Jira new issue view displays a truncated issuekey. In this case CMX-2 (Granted, the actual value of that link is the correct issue, but as an end user it really makes you question what you entered because it is displaying a different key here)

!looks like wrong key.png|width=405,height=77!
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: When using Link issue in the new issue view and entering an issuekey the complete issuekey is not displayed until the link is saved

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we try to create an issue from MS teams, if we type in any project that is not present in the drop down list then the Create issue screen gets stuck as the issue types are not loaded.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click "Create issue" in MS teams 
 # Do not select any project from the drop down list presented. Instead type a project name that is not present in the drop down list.

h3. Expected Results
Create issue screen should load.

h3. Actual Results
Create issue screen gets stuck in a loop.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes
Same behaviour is noticed for Creating custom filters as well. If we type a project name which is not part of drop down then no filters are loaded.
fields.summary: While trying to create an issue in MS teams it does not load the "Create issue" screen after typing a project name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While we know that "Regenerate Notes" option would only work when the Layout is changed and not when the Format is changed, it's misleading for the users as they would wait until the button turns clickable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Release Notes page.
 # Change the Format from HTML to Markdown or vice-versa but the "Regenerate button" is still greyed out. (Its Just a UI issue but the format changes in the background)

h3. Expected Results

Regenerate Notes button should be either clickable or should not be present or else it creates confusion among users that something is incomplete.
h3. Actual Results

"Regenerate Notes" is greyed out even after changing the Format but only activates when the layout is changed.
h3. Workaround

Switch between the different Layouts to activate the button and regenerate the notes.
fields.summary: Regenerate Notes button in Release Notes is greyed out

fields.description:
Please add the option (field) to search for filters by the Filter ID. 

From this page: [https://brierley.atlassian.net/jira/filters]

This would enable a much more powerful search.  Often when linking to a Filter only the filter number is displayed and not the Filter name.  This is really important because a number of the gadgets in Jira/Confluence require the Filter Name not the Filter Number to pull in the results. 

Something like this: 

!image-2021-04-14-08-22-45-120.png|width=1107,height=196!

Example of view without the Filter Name when clicking from a Gadget in Jira: 

!image-2021-04-14-08-25-27-784.png|width=797,height=294!
fields.summary: Enable the Ability to Search for Filters with the Filter ID

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

As an admin, I would like to configure Microsoft OAuth incoming mail servers with other mail protocols other than IMAP. This is a limitation for organizations that do not allow IMAP to be used on their mail.
fields.summary: Allow Microsoft OAuth incoming mail servers to be configured with other mail protocols other than IMAP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the presence of a custom field called *Date of First Response* and type *Date of First Response*, the *Time to First Response* gadget won't show any data unless this field has a global context
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field called *Date of First Response* and type *Date of First Response* with  limited context 
 # Ensure the *[CHART] Date of First Response* field has a global context and is not hidden from the field configuration
 !image-2021-04-14-16-00-24-472.png|width=469,height=43!
 # Create a few issues and add comments by a user who is not a reporter
 # Ensure the field *[CHART] Date of First Response* has values in all those issues
 # Create a dashboard and add the gadget *Time To First Response* with a filter that pulls all these issues

h3. Expected Results

As per the public KB [Time to First Response gadget does not display data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/time-to-first-response-gadget-does-not-display-data-779160763.html], the *Time to First Response* gadget should show data
h3. Actual Results

Gadget is showing blank 
h3. Workaround

Set both fields to have a global context. It appears that the gadget goes by field type rather than name, requiring all fields of type *Date of First Response* to be global
fields.summary: In the presence of a custom field called 'Date of First Response' alongside '[CHART] Date of First Response', the 'Time to First Response' gadget won't show any data unless both fields have a global context

fields.description:
In the old issue view, we have the option to define a panel which will encompass all related items. ie: Images, code section etc. 

In the new issue view it breaks it into Info panel, followed by images and code as separate items. 

Suggestion: Panel to behave in a similar way to old issue view and encompass all related information. 

Old issue view, enter the following:
{panel:title=S1 |borderStyle=solid|titleBGColor=#7FC7CE} 
Some text...

An Image:  [^2..snagproj] 

Some text... 

Some code:
{code}Enter some code
{code}
{panel}

Under old issue view, this will look like:
 !image-2021-04-14-14-42-17-640.png|thumbnail! 

Under new issue view, this will look like:
 !image-2021-04-14-14-42-54-239.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Information panel breaks when image or code is added

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a cascading select field is in the right hand side of the new issue view and it only has a single values selected, the second level of values is obscured by the dropdown for the first level and disappears when the field is not actively being edited. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or use an existing {{Select List (cascading)}} custom field with multiple levels of values configured. (most Jira Service Management projects come with one configured out of the box) 
 # Ensure that the field is in the right-hand-side of issue layout (it usually is by default)
 # In an issue, select a value for the first level of the field
 # Refresh the page (as if being a new user or much time has passed)
 # See that the field in question appears to have a single value
 # Click the field to begin editing

h3. Expected Results

Either:
 * the second level of the field is focused when editing begins so the user can clearly see that there is a second level to be edited

 * OR that the empty second value selector is shown even when not editing to show that there is a second level of values to be selected

h3. Actual Results

When the field is selected for editing, the first level of the selector dropdown opens at the same time that the second level field becomes visible. 
 The dropdown of the first level obscures the empty second level field.
h3. Workaround

Press the {{Tab}} button on the keyboard to switch focus to the second level of the cascading select field.
fields.summary: Editing a Cascading Select field with only a first-level existing value makes it difficult to edit or even know about a possible second value

fields.description: Sometimes the fields in a tab are empty and could be hidden to increase performance, at this time the tabs are always showing.
fields.summary: Add an option to hide screen tabs when the fields are empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

iOS 14 introduced live photos with a new format (*.pvt) and the app is not importing these photos properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Attach a live photo in a Jira issue.
h3. Expected Results

A PNG/JPG file (with preview) is available.
h3. Actual Results

A PVT attachment is attached and no preview appears. 
h3. Workaround

 

If the photo is taken with the Live setting turned off, the issue is resolved (the photo uploads as .jpg as expected).

 

*More context*

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Pictures-uploading-as-pvt-from-Jira-mobile-app/qaq-p/1551671?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_reply&utm_content=topic
fields.summary: Live photos not uploaded as .png in iOS App

fields.description:
In the old issue view subtasks are shown with a numbered list, in the new issue view, this is not happening.
https://share.getcloudapp.com/E0uY4ezz
fields.summary: Add an option to list the subtasks with numbers like it was shown in the old issue view

fields.description:
* Some customers have multiple Jira instances and it will be helpful if there's an option to create reports with these instances as data sources.
 Or
 * A feature that enables site admins to generate reports for multiple projects (perhaps 10 at a time or more). This will help collectively generate reports for multiple projects that have similar reporting requirements, instead of the current practice where if there are 20 projects site admins have to go to each Project > Reports > Select Report and Generate.
fields.summary: Ability to generate reports from multiple cloud instances

fields.description:
Please keep the comments in Jira as they were. The change of order is far too confusing, especially when people reference a comment "above" (Are they a time traveller?)

If it must stay fix these things:
 * One setting to rule them all, not a per-ticket configuration
 * Default configuration is as it was (oldest on top)
 * Fix the bug when ordering them oldest on top it should load the comments correctly. It will load the first comments, rather than the most recent

Basically, put it back.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Stop with the comment ordering nonsense

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
When a project is created with shared configuration, it associates the newly created project with all schemes from the selected project.

Users often use this to sort of "copy" the project configuration, however, some custom fields might have a context specified by project and the newly created project won't be automatically added to the respective context of the custom fields.

h3. Suggestion
Alert if context of field is missing upon creation or project with shared configuration so users can make the proper changes they need.
fields.summary: Alert if context of field is missing upon creation or project with shared configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attaching images with EXIF orientation metadata to comments makes the image look like it has a border during editing.

Examples with and without metadata attached.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue and go to the comment section
 # Attach an image with EXIF orientation metadata
    !test.png|width=235,height=135!

h3. Expected Results

The image should appear in the comment section and be resizable.

This is true for images that do not have the metadata.

!noborder.png|width=183,height=150!
h3. Actual Results

The image loads with a border that disappears after saving the comment and refreshing the page.
 * While editing
 !border.png|width=257,height=196!
 * After saving and refreshing
 !after.png|width=257,height=196!

h3. Workaround

This is only visual, after the comment is saved the image appears as it should.
fields.summary: Attaching an image with EXIF metadata makes the image have a border while editing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The smart value *{{fieldChange}}* can be used to use the value a field changed to during an action. 

Currently, if you try to populate the field *Labels* with a value from a select list field by using the *{{fieldChange}}* smart value it will fail with an error stating that the value contains a space:
{code}
Error editing issues
B2R-9 (The label '{self=https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/customFieldOption/10209, value=option-b, id=10209}' can't contain spaces. (labels))
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create an automation rule based on the change of a field (select list) that will populate the field *Labels* with that value:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-12 at 13.01.27.png|thumbnail! 
* Create an issue, selecting a value for the field you are using as the criteria.

h3. Expected Results

The field labels will be populated with the value that was selected during the issue's creation.

h3. Actual Results

The field will not be populated and an error will be logged in the rule's audit log.

h3. Workaround

Use an action based on the issue created trigger, and simply copy the value selected to the labels field using smart values:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-12 at 13.14.54.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using {{fieldChange}} to populate Labels during issue creation will fail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira notifications are adding a default icon to issue types and ignoring the actual issue type icon.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new issue
** Make sure that you'll receive the agent notification of issue created
# When the user receive notification from JIRA related to this particular issue type, the icon related to this issue type won't be shown, but a default one.

 !Issue type.png|thumbnail! 

 !Issue type2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results

Email notification should display the custom issue type's icon selected in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results

The system will display always the same icon independent of the issue type.

The same behavior occurs in other notifications, like issue assigned, issue commented, etc.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Icons of issue types aren't correctly displayed on email notification to users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using Calendar gadget along with Pie Chart breaks the layout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard and add a couple of Pie Charts(at least 3)
## Make sure that the filter results returns enough items to show the *Other* option on the Pie chart
# Now add a Calendar gadget
# Hover the mouse over the "other" options on the Pie Chart

h3. Expected Results
The results should be displayed just fine.

h3. Actual Results
The pop-up that opens up to display the "other" results is displayed on the left side in a fixed position which makes the results unreadable in some instances.
 !image-2021-04-12-10-07-01-337.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the Calendar gadget from the dashboard
fields.summary: Using Calendar gadget along with Pie Chart breaks the layout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the any gadget in Dashboard, it is not recommended to use a saved filter that uses purely issue keys as its JQL because if there are too many issue keys in the query then the request will be too large and cause it to break.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a saved filter using only issue keys ("key in (PKEY-1, PKEY-2, PKEY-3, PKEY-4)"). This was tested with 600 issue keys and above.
 # As an example, add the *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* gadget to your Dashboard and use that saved filter you've just created
 # Click on the highlighted number count to view the results of the XAxis or YAxis field selected.

!2021-04-12_13-33-09.gif|width=400!
h3. Expected Results

You will be redirected to a new tab displaying the results based on the XAxis or YAxis field used.
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
414 Request-URI Too Large
{code}
!2021-04-12_13-29-31.gif|width=400!
h3. Workaround

The saved filter must be adjusted to use field references for its JQL and not purely use issue keys.
fields.summary: Request too large for Dashboard gadget with too many issue keys
